derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (earlier as chiche-pease): from late Middle English chiche (from Old French chiche, cice, from Latin cicer 'chickpea') + pease

entry.def: Chickpeas are hard round seeds that look like pale brown peas. They can be cooked and eaten.

means.word_mean: 1. the seed of the chickpea plant
2. Asiatic herb cultivated for its short pods with one or two edible seeds
3. large white roundish Asiatic legume; usually dried
